page.title: 20St.Andrew's Church, P. Wood
page.content: St.Andrew's Church was completed in 1955,following the bombing of the previous church on 4th November 1940. Today St. Andrew's is a joint Anglican Methodist Church.The central point in the church is the Lord's table. The lectern is in the shape of an eagle.The font is used for both adult and child baptisms.The organ is in the east wing. The vestry lies between the south and west transepts.This room also acts as an office. Services are taken by various clergymen.Reverend D.Winter has been the vicar since 1966.There are four main services held at the church.These are Morning Prayer,Holy Communion, Evening Prayer and family services. Special services are held at Christmas and Easter.The church can accommodate approximately 500 people.Between 200 to 300 people attend the church services.
